content.description: Find the start just right of the obvious crack system on the left side of the wall. The start is dirty as of this week (we forgot one of the tools for cleaning) but soon it will be excellent.

climbs.name: Team Effort
climbs.fa: Nuri Betof and the ICF New Routers

content.description: Just right of the cave at the left side of Fist Full of Quickdraws wall. This route and the route to it's left, Hell or High Stepp'n, were established by a group of climbers in a clinic during the International Climbers Festival.

A tricky climb on some classic Wild Iris stone. Good pockets and easy movement lead to a hard move out left around the 3rd bolt. Get a quick shake before the wall steepens then move through a series of marginal pockets and hard to see feet before the wall slabs out.
content.location: Just to the left of "A Few Quickdraws More", the corner/crack climb left of "Cowboy King" start. "A Few More Dead" links into the top of this climb from the corner

content.description: This route may not get as much love as its neighbors, but it's just as much fun! Thin pockets lead you to a long pull to a mono followed by endurance cranking on good pockets. Follow the slab to the double roof and finish on a junior version of American Beauty!
content.location: Right of AB, left of CCE

climbs.name: Hell or High Stepp'n
climbs.fa: Ryan Horner and the ICF New Routers

content.description: Find the start just left of the cave at the left side of the Fist Full of Quickdraws Wall. This route and the route to its right, Team Effort, were established during a clinic on how to build new routes at the 2017 International Climbers Festival.

This route features great movement between good pockets. The moves can be reachy at times but the crux at 2/3 height provides a few options of pockets to choose from. Following the crux a 20' runout (5.8) leads to the anchors.
content.location: This route starts in the center of the wall just left of the giant unmistakable overlapping roofs of Cowboy King and American Beauty. Currently (2016) the center of the three routes on this wall.

content.description: A Wild Iris mega classic. Cowboy king is as good as it gets for climbing of the grade in Wyoming. It climbs perfect white limestone up delicate slab to a no hands rest below a two tiered roof. Bust out the first then take a wild ride up the right of two routes that split (left is Bronc Twister). Have your two finger pocket roof climbing game on point for the last bit. Incredibly good climbing on perfect stone.
content.location: Climbs the longest section of roof in the Aspen Glades zone.

content.description: If I could give this route 5 stars, I would. Outstanding two and three finger pockets lead up a beautiful sweep of white stone. Finish the route through a tiered roof system.
content.protection: Bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
The rightmost route on the Cowboy King Wall. Choke Cherry finishes to the right of the huge bulbs that American Beauty and Bronc Twister climb through.

Begin on opposing sidepulls and continue up the beautiful face above using sinker pockets.

content.description: This route begins on the Cowboy King slab and then breaks left out on the final roof. Enjoy the hard entry moves and a decent rest before a couple hard-as-nails moves to take you to anchor. Keep the name in mind...
content.protection: Bring draws for the anchor, though there is a single hitch above the two glue-in bolts.
content.location: Same start as Cowboy King, but bust left out the final roof instead of right for the King.

content.description: Begin with good pockets on fantastic vertical to slabby 5.11c 'ish face climbing to a stance below the obvious roof.  Big moves on mostly good holds leads out the roof to a hard to see jug at the anchors. Falling while going for the anchors (crux) leads to a great, bowel churning free air fall.
content.protection: Bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: When looking at the main Cowboy King Wall (the central wall with huge roof), American Beauty is the second bolted line from the left (the first bolted line is the start for two 5.13's out the left side of the roof).

content.description: Climb the corner and face left of the big roof routes and two routes right of Fist Full of Quickdraws.
content.protection: Nine or ten quickdraws plus anchors
content.location: Double corner left of Bronc Twister and Cowboy King

content.description: Climb the first 5-6 bolts of A Few Quick Draws more then clip two bolts going left and linking up with The Quick and the Dead (the .11d right of Fist Full of Quickdraws.) It's basically a V4 crux.
content.location: Starts in the corner that is A Few Quickdraws More and moves left.
